@graph.name: Vermicelli Pudding - Seviyan Kheer
@graph.description: Vegan Vermicelli pudding or Semiyan Kheer is a pudding made with roasted vermicelli noodles. Indian, Vegan , gluten-free option, nut-free option.
recipeIngredient: 2 tablespoons raw cashew pieces or other nuts like raw pistachios or almond slivers
2 tablespoons golden raisins or other dried fruit
1/2 cup vermicelli noodles (broken into 4 to 5 inch pieces, use Thai Rice vermicelli for gf)
2 cups almond milk  (or other non dairy milk)
2 to 3 tablespoons sugar or to taste
for variation: use 6 saffron strands or 1/2 tsp rose water instead of vanilla

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. When hot, add cashews and cook until lightly golden on some edges. 1 to 2 minutes. Add raisins and cook until they puff up. Remove the cashews and raisins and keep aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. When hot, add cashews and cook until lightly golden on some edges. 1 to 2 minutes. Add raisins and cook until they puff up. Remove the cashews and raisins and keep aside.

recipeInstructions.text: In the same pan, add cardamom, cloves, salt and vermicelli noodles and cook over medium heat until the noodles turn golden. 4 to 7 minutes depending on the noodles used. Rice vermicelli takes longer to roast. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.
recipeInstructions.name: In the same pan, add cardamom, cloves, salt and vermicelli noodles and cook over medium heat until the noodles turn golden. 4 to 7 minutes depending on the noodles used. Rice vermicelli takes longer to roast. Stir occasionally to avoid burning.

recipeInstructions.text: Add almond milk and bring to a boil.
recipeInstructions.name: Add almond milk and bring to a boil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add sugar, vanilla and mix in. Reduce heat to low-medium and continue to cook until the noodles are cooked through. 5 to 7 minutes. Taste and adjust sweet.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sugar, vanilla and mix in. Reduce heat to low-medium and continue to cook until the noodles are cooked through. 5 to 7 minutes. Taste and adjust sweet.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in half of the cashews and raisins. If the pudding is not thick, add ground cashew and mix in. Continue to cook for another 3 to 4 minutes or until desired consistency. The Pudding will thicken more once cool.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with the remaining cashews and raisins. Chill, discard the clove and serve.
